definition: to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth

sentences.english: Such is the talent of the director.
sentences.chinese: 這就是導演才華洋溢的地方。

sentences.english: Pop dot long T collocation tooling tall waist trousers, small lovely overflow.
sentences.chinese: 波普圓點長T搭配工裝高腰褲，小可愛洋溢。

sentences.english: Richard is an actor who knows how to exuberate .
sentences.chinese: 理查是個知道如何表現得熱情洋溢的演員。

sentences.english: The resulting response to the light has not been as effusive as expected.
sentences.chinese: 對於光的迴應並不如期盼的熱情洋溢。

sentences.english: The village rang with the joy of Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 村裏洋溢著聖誕節的歡樂氣氛。

sentences.english: She kept looking out of the window, suffused with the warmth from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她目不轉睛地望着窗外，身上洋溢着火爐的熱意。

sentences.english: At the top of the country's film industry, the mood is both bullish and ebullient.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利電影界的上層，充滿了昂揚和熱情洋溢的氣氛。

sentences.english: Your self confidence will again flow freely.
sentences.chinese: 你的自信將再次自由洋溢。
她是個才華洋溢的設計師。

sentences.english: Her heart always glows with enthusiasm.

sentences.chinese: 激情洋溢，充滿活力，熱力四射。

sentences.english: The sprawling campus is pleasant enough but badly dilapidated.
sentences.chinese: 現在校園裏洋溢着吉慶，但面貌仍是極度破敗。

sentences.english: Bill was so passionate about explaining his vision that he was leaping over the campfire.
sentences.chinese: 比爾熱情洋溢地解釋他的夢想，以至於他跳過了篝火。

sentences.english: Sometimes castor oil can also be used as an ebullient.
sentences.chinese: 有時蓖麻油還可以用作了熱情洋溢。

sentences.english: This wine has been vinified to express the typical fruit characteristics of the Chilean Valleys.
sentences.chinese: 此酒洋溢着來自智利山谷的典型果香。

definition: to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
